attributes.action: Move Trident from Scotland to Plymouth Devon
attributes.background: Scotland do not want Trident and the SNP have been fighting this vehemently . Meanwhile in Plymouth we have the capacity and would welcome the jobs with open arms

attributes.action: Urge the Governments in China, Vietnam & Asia to ban the Dog Meat Trade
attributes.background: I was physically sick when I saw a video on Facebook depicting the torturing to death of dogs for human consumption. The dogs are kept in horrific conditions & as sentient animals, feel the same emotions that we do. They are absolutely terrified. It is inhumane, barbaric & abhorrent & needs to stop
attributes.additional_details: The Yulin Dog Meat Festival & Asian Dog Meat Trade focuses on farming dogs for human consumption. Thousands of dogs are rammed into tiny cages, contorted & left to weaken. Dogs are happy animals & it is believed that their happiness & good health is passed onto those who eat them. The perpetrators think that torturing the dogs by blow torching & skinning them alive & battering their heads willl keep the meat tender. Videos & live Facebook appearances, notably by Ricky Gervais are ref points.

attributes.action: Accept Functional Skills as an equivalent qualification for EYE's Level 3
attributes.background: I am very concerned about the negative impact of the Government’s decision that all Level 3 Early Years Educators must have at least a C grade in GCSE English and maths with no equitable alternative such as Functional Skills allowed.
attributes.additional_details: Your policy will mean there will be a significant shortfall in the number of Level 3 childcare practitioners, which threatens the quality of care that children will get in early years settings.

attributes.action: Remove  Disabled Families/Parents/Children from the Troubled Families Policy
attributes.background:
We request that you fully support Disabled Families complete removal from this program.
Plus support a full public consultation to be launched to investigate. 
Why it was even deemed acceptable in the first place for Disabled Families inclusion in this policy.
attributes.additional_details:
Troubled Families Policy. 
As it stands the categories are: 
Parents and children involved in crime or anti-social behaviour 
Children who have not been attending school regularly 
Children who need help 
Adults out of work or at risk of financial exclusion and young people at risk of worklessness 
Families affected by domestic violence and abuse 
Parents and children with a range of health problems.

attributes.action: Reverse the decision to pay Govia Thameslink Railway £20m of Taxpayer Money
attributes.background:
Govia Thameslink Railway (GTR) has been granted a £20m fund to "get to grips" with problems on the Southern rail network.

GTR is jointly owned by Go-Ahead (2/3) and Keolis (1/3), who between them also hold the Southeastern and London Midland franchises.
attributes.additional_details:
On 2nd September 2016, Go-Ahead announced full-year profits (y/e 2nd July 2016) of £99.8m, an increase of 26.8% over the previous financial year.

Parliament should debate whether the payment of £20m can be justified in light of the demonstrated profitability of Go-Ahead, or whether a private enterprise should fund the improvements to its service from cash on deposit and profits.

If GTR cannot or will not fund the improvements to services, it should consider resigning its franchises.

attributes.action: Legalise use of medical marijuana for chronic pain (and other conditions)
attributes.background:
Myself (and many others in the UK) struggle daily with chronic pain and other painful problems out of our control.

Why should patients suffer major side effects from pain meds meaning they are unable to function normally in day to day life leading to job insecurity, and reducing their dignity.
attributes.additional_details:
"Almost 10 million Britons suffer pain almost daily resulting in a major impact on their quality of life and more days off work." - https://www.britishpainsociety.org/media-resources/

"Medical Marijuana Seems Safe for Chronic Pain" - http://www.webmd.com/pain-management/news/20151007/medical-marijuana-seems-safe-for-chronic-pain-patients-study-finds

"Cannabis use... better quality of life in patients with chronic pain." - http://www.jpain.org/article/S1526-5900(16)00567-8/abstract

attributes.action: We want bully's expelled from school. No second chance.
attributes.background:
Lets influence school's 
kick the bully out on the first strike.
Fine the parents, keep the rejects away from our decent children!
Why should the victims be taught at home while the Teachers Governors and Police sit back. Why do bully's receive more help than their victims?

attributes.action: Parliament to postpone the implementation of Article 50, for at least 6 months.
attributes.background: Further to the recent European Referendum, it now appears evident that the European Union acknowledges that changes must be made to better meet the current needs of member countries.  The UK should not leave the European Union until such time as the extent of any proposed changes are known.
attributes.additional_details: If those proposals still fall short of UK requirements for continued membership it will then be possible to negotiate exit arrangements with better knowledge of the future EU structure and conditions.

attributes.action: Allow UKSA to prosecute politicians who state incorrect statistics
attributes.background: In the recent campaign the Leave side kept mentioning the incorrect £350m amount going to the EU. The head of the ONS asked them to stop but they didn't. The UKSA should be able to prosecute politicians, political parties and campaigns from repeating incorrect stats and force to print retractions.
attributes.additional_details:
These 2 articles relate to the £350m claim.
https://fullfact.org/blog/2016/apr/uk-statistics-authority-350-million-eu-membership-fee-potentially-misleading/
www.theguardian.com/politics/reality-check/2016/may/23/does-the-eu-really-cost-the-uk-350m-a-week

As this article describes the UKSA are the organisation required to point out to politicians where they misuse statistics but they lack the teeth to do more.
www.bbc.co.uk/news/blogs-magazine-monitor-28061826

attributes.action: Ban disposable plastic crockery and cutlery to help the environment
attributes.background: Recently France became the first country to pass an all-out ban on plastic cutlery, plates, and cups. Let's follow their example through a ban on disposable plastic tableware. These plastics affect our environment and use fossil fuels. Plastic pollution is a pervasive issue but we can change this.
attributes.additional_details:
Plastics are extremely durable, lightweight, cheap and versatile - features which mean that they have replaced many traditional materials such as metal, glass and wood. Unfortunately these features make them the most pervasive, persistent and hazardous form of litter in our environment. 

Furthermore, plastic manufacturing is estimated to use 8 percent of yearly global oil production. This precious resource is being wasted on disposable products for 'convenience'. This is not sustainable.

attributes.action: Raise the voting age to 21
attributes.background: Stop under 21s from voting due to lack of life experiences,

attributes.action: Enforce taxi companies to charge accessible taxis the same as inaccessible ones
attributes.background:
A disabled person can end up paying 3 or 4 times more for a taxi journey compared to a non-disabled person. 
The same journey in an accessible taxi was £13.50 whereas friends in an inaccessible taxi were only charged £4.50.
attributes.additional_details:
It is unfair to charge a disabled person more for the same journey because they are disabled. 
Having a disability is already expensive, adding another cost to someone purely because they require a wheelchair (or other mobility aides) is discriminatory. 
The Equality Act 2010 Section 15 states that a person cannot be treated unfavourably because of their disability. 
Therefore I call on the government to change legislation so that disabled people aren't charged more due to their disability.

attributes.action: Introduce Universal Basic Income (ie. a guaranteed income for all) to the UK
attributes.background:
What would you do differently with your life if your income was guaranteed, what positive choices would you make?

Universal Basic Income is a form of social security system in which all citizens or residents of a country regularly receive an unconditional sum of money.
attributes.additional_details:
Universal Basic Income is gathering momentum and there have been many positive tests across the world.

http://basicincome.org.uk/reasons-support-basic-income/

Recent tests saw increased divorce rates as the freedom UBI brings allows women in abusive relationships to leave. People worked harder and donated their time to good causes.

attributes.action: Discuss ways to ensure all private landlords protect deposits paid by tenants
attributes.background: Though the Housing Act 2004, Section 213 lays out what is expected of  private landlords and the requirements relating to tenancy deposits; a significant amount of private landlords fail to protect deposits put down by their tenants and escape the penalty for failing to do so.
attributes.additional_details: I am asking that the government discuss creating measures to ensure that all tenancy deposits are protected in a government backed scheme by private landlords. I submit that landlords should face a penalty for failing to protect tenancy deposits immediately after 30 days and not solely if a tenant takes their landlord to court usually half way through or at the end of a tenancy agreement.

attributes.action: GIVE VOTING RIGHTS TO EU NATIONALS LIVING IN UK FOR MORE THAN 15 YRS
attributes.background:
In the Brexit referendum, Brits living abroad less than 15 years and all
Commenwealth citizens living in the UK were allowed to vote. It does not make sense for the government not to allow EU citizens to have a vote.
attributes.additional_details:
EU citizens living in the UK contribute financially, they are here legally and are often not allowed to vote in their home countries.
Equal rights should include the right to vote.
If the government has decided that Brits living abroad for more then 15 years should not be able to vote, then it should be obvious to grant EU citizens living here for 15 years and more the right to vote.
Many of the European nationals have not changed their passport because there was no need to.

attributes.action: Make LA's provide Post 16 Autism specific education provision in the local area
attributes.background: There are not enough education provisions for autistic young people aged 16+ within local areas. This is such a difficult transitional stage in their lives and many are forced to travel long distances in order to attend an appropriate provision that can meet their individual needs. This has to stop.
attributes.additional_details:
As a parent of an autistic child I feel incredibly anxious regarding this issue. 
Transition from child to adult services is difficult and I feel by continuing education within the local community, would promote much better long term outcomes for individuals as well as their families. I also believe it would be financially better for Local Authorities to provide this rather than sending these vunerable members of society out of borough. So please sign this and let's make a positive change now

attributes.action: Additional Law for Police to seize stationary Uninsured/Unregistered vehicles
attributes.background: Currently Police don't have the power to seize vehicles that are parked unattended and uninsured on our roads under S.165 Road Traffic Act 1988 if its taxed etc. A huge problem is criminals buying these cars, not being the registered owner therefore evading possible penalties incurred.
attributes.additional_details:
A REGISTERED vehicle which has INSURANCE will be traceable when it comes to NtO (Fines) etc... 
But if Un-registered / Un-Insured = No parking fines, No speeding fines EVER and driver/owner untraceable to authorities unless they are caught in the act with the vehicle. I petition to enforce a power for police to seize any vehicle on a public road that is not lawfully insured regardless if the owner has been caught driving it or not.
We must be Proactive and not Reactive in crime prevention!

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for patients to have a full blood count every 6-12 months
attributes.background: My 2 year old was poorly despite going to the doctors and seeing 3 different ones it was all dismissed as nothing and even though I asked for a blood test for her we were refused. I took her to A+E and the morning after she was diagnosed with luekemia on 06-04-16.
attributes.additional_details: My daughter at 2 years old was poorly for a few weeks with aches and pains, unexplained bruising, weight loss, constant fatigue and tiredness and a swollen face. GPS were of no help and we were dismissed each time. It took my health visitor to tell the gp there was something wrong for them to tell her to tell me to go to A+E the next day she was diagnosed with T-ALL and the swelling in her face was due to a tumour in her chest pressing on her airways she couldn't breathe properly + needed oxygen

attributes.action: Help support me to bring about 'Kieron's Law.'
attributes.background: I want to call on Government for information leaflets to be sent to every household in the UK to show natural parents their rights as described here-  https://www.gov.uk/child-adoption/birth-parents-your-rights. I do-not have a live Case which pertains to child custody decisions being made in Court
attributes.additional_details: Through lack of information rights, i almost died as a consequence. I'm recovering alcoholic of 8 years. I call on Government to add information to include parental rights, data protection rights, children's rights, compliments and complaints links to Children's Services, Cafcass, medical court expert witnesses, Judges, Solicitors, Barnardo's, Surestart and links to human rights. I would request that this information be added where Local Councils provide the printed information already.

attributes.action: Add a "none of the above" option to all ballot papers.
attributes.background: Consent is central to the concept of democracy. But consent is only measurable if it is possible to withhold it. This is not possible in current elections as the only options available are abstaining and spoiling the ballot in protest - neither being an accurate measure of voter discontent.
attributes.additional_details:
The above introduction was based on the following page from 38degrees. This page provides more information and context as to the importance of a "none of the above option"

https://you.38degrees.org.uk/petitions/inclusion-of-an-official-none-of-the-above-option-for-all-uk-elections-2

attributes.action: Make it law that cyclists have to have insurance the same as car drivers
attributes.background: I believe that cyclists should have to have insurance and registration so they can be identified and held accountable for traffic offences and incidents that they are responsible for.
attributes.additional_details:
Cyclists use the roads exactly the same as car drivers who have to have a license, Car tax and insurance but cyclists have none.

I believe as a driver that cyclists should have to have insurance and a registration so they can be held accountable for breaking road traffic laws and incidents / accidents that they cause including what I think is the most common road traffic law that cyclists break which is not stopping at red traffic lights.

attributes.action: I wish the Home Office to review the case of a Fijian soldier Semesa Maiyale.
attributes.background: Semesa Maiyale known as Sam joined the British army in 2003 and served with the Kings Own Scottish Borders and then the Royal Regiment of Scotand serving nine years,completed tours of Iraq and was promised the right to remain in the Uk after his service ended.
attributes.additional_details: Sam was discharged in 2012, Sam has no right to work, cannot claim benefits or housing and is supported by his partner who as a staff nurse is having to provide for the both of them and their son. sam rightly feels betrayed and let down.

attributes.action: Local councils must adhere to The Care Act; by offering choice of care provider.
attributes.background: In an attempt to reduce cost councils (LA's) are removing the right of choice from those who receive care and support. By appointing one provider forcing people to accept the care provider offered rather than the one better placed to support them.
attributes.additional_details:
Central to the Care Act 2014 is wellbeing. At the heart of the principle of wellbeing is ‘control over day- to-day life, including over care and support and the way it is provided.’

This is because choice and control is fundamental to the core purpose of adult care and support which the Care Act guidance sees as being to ‘help people to achieve the outcomes that matter to them in their life.’ 

Current practice is not recognising the legialation introduced to protect vulnerable people.

attributes.action: Grant maintenance loans to full time distance learning students
attributes.background: I'm a student studying at the open university and I have chosen to study full time, this means I don't have time for a job, however I am only eligible for a part time tuition fee loan as I am a distance learning student, this means I only get my tuition fee paid for.
attributes.additional_details: As distance learning students we have to study harder because we don't have as many face to face lectures with out tutor and those of us that choose to do our degree full time are not eligible for a maintenance loan to help support us through our studies like other full time students which then means since we don't have time for a full time job and sometimes a part time job either depending on out degree we have to find other ways to support us financially through our studies.

attributes.action: legal aid for child acces cases so low income parents aren't stuck in a dispute.
attributes.background: Dad's up and down the country are left with no legal ways to gain access to their children after a dispute with an ex partner due to the high legal costs they can't afford. This has lead to suicide and unlawful attempts to see their children. For this reason. They need the help of the government.

attributes.action: Institute an independent audit system for the EU Referendum count.
attributes.background: Recent elections have demonstrated an alarming series of errors which may be, or have been, deliberately used to distort the result beyond acceptable limits. There is no confidence in the Electoral Commission UK in their own handling of the necessary oversights at each stage of the process.
attributes.additional_details:
A series of known tactics are possibly being used to distort the result beyond acceptable margins, e.g. Barnet registers omitting names, May 2016; East Devon registers contains names which should not have been there, May 2015; South Thanet General Election count delay for twelve hours being unexplained, May 2015; the Legality of a variety of Electoral procedures being ignored by parties 2014-2015.Etc. 
A team of three independent inspectors must be appointed by an MP's Committee for each counting centre.

attributes.action: Abolish the 2 year retake of the CBT.
attributes.background: Every two years I, as many other "L" riders, have to fork out another £90 to retake my compulsory bike test. I have no need to apply for my full  larger engine test due to my short commute (a full 15 miles a day). I do not know of any other vehicle licences that need to have a two year "refresher".

attributes.action: Make Organ Donation compulsory in the U.K. unless an individual opts out.
attributes.background:
As of 2010, 24 European countries have some form of presumed consent (opt-out) system, with the most prominent and limited opt-out systems in Spain, Austria, and Belgium yielding high donor rates.

In the United Kingdom organ donation is voluntary and no consent is presumed.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently there are over 7,000 people on the UK national transplant waiting list and, during the last financial year, over 1,300 people either died whilst on the waiting list or became too sick to receive a transplant. This is because, despite more than 500,000 people dying each year in the UK, fewer than 5,000 people die in circumstances where they can become a donor. 

If we can increase the amount of people by only 5% this will save lives each and every week in the UK.

attributes.action: The IPCC to have control over decisions in an investigation against the police.
attributes.background: We the undersigned, want a change in law so the IPCC have total control over all decisions in an investigation against the police. For example; when an officer has been suspended on a criminal charge. This has come to our attention after the fatal shooting of Jermaine Baker.

attributes.action: Conviction of violence towards NHS staff hold a mandatory custodial sentence
attributes.background: Too many NHS staff are being assaulted whilst trying to help those in need and a mandatory custodial prison sentence needs to be in place for anyone convicted of it.

attributes.action: Call for a Public Enquiry into TTIP, CETA & all future Free Trade Agreements.
attributes.background:
The EU and Canada have concluded secret negotiations in the proposed trade agreement CETA, which is now in the process of ratification.

Most commentators believe this constitutes the beginning of the 'race to the bottom' in standards and regulations for food, the environment and public services.
attributes.additional_details:
Included within CETA are the controversial investor-state dispute settlement (ISDS) mechanism and Regulatory Cooperation, which brings international trade harmonisation and greater corporate profits at the expense of public safety. It is said that CETA leaves the back door open for TTIP.

We ask this Enquiry to investigate CETA & TTIP, recommend safeguards for the publics interest in all future UK trade agreements and for legislation to outlaw the practice of secret free trade negotiations.

attributes.action: Raise old aged pensioners personal expenses allowance from £24.90 a week to £50
attributes.background: Once a person goes into a care home the Government takes away their private pension, their state pension and any other money they have and  allows them just  £24.90 a week. That has to pay for everything from clothes and toiletries, to small treats like having hair done or the odd day trip out.

attributes.action: Revise section 59 and withdraw the photographer / Car Spotter 48 hour ban/fine
attributes.background: Section 59 is being abused by officers, it is used to threaten high powered supercar owners. The Police Reform Act needs to be revised and officers reminded on how to use there authority. Also car spotters should not face any ban or fine due to the actions of drivers and should be left alone.
attributes.additional_details:
There have been 2 cases of police issuing bans to car spotters and i feel that it is assured, anyone has the right to take a picture. Even so there may be tourists who have flown in and may simply want to take a picture of a luxurious sports car to then face a ban in a well known tourist attraction with a fine. Also in the papers wealthy luxurious have been finding there stay here very troubling and unwelcoming as the police have been stopping them purely for the fact that they can.  

NOCKAM

attributes.action: Make NHS gender service waiting times easier for transgender people
attributes.background: I am asking to ease the long waiting times for gender services in the UK, by allowing trans people to begin reversible treatment before they are seen by a specialist. This would prevent them from struggling with crippling gender dysphoria while they are on the waiting list, which can be over a year.
attributes.additional_details:
Lots of trans patients suffer with gender dysphoria, which in turn causes depression and suicidal feelings. Not being able to begin treatment can have a severe impact on mental health.
Many trans people take hormone blockers. This is a drug which is completely safe, 100% reversible and prevents trans people from going through changes which don't match their gender identity. All I ask is that the use of hormone blockers in the waiting period is considered, so their general wellbeing is improved.

attributes.action: Stop The Council Penalty Charges for Driving in Bus Lanes on Bank Holidays!
attributes.background:
I was given 3 separate tickets for driving in a bus lane on a Bank Holiday by Harrow Council, each a few seconds apart.

I do not drive on bus lanes but after my investigation, I realised it was on a bank holiday and I must have assumed because it was bank holiday the same rules on Sunday applies.
attributes.additional_details:
Stop The Council from issuing Penalty Charges for Driving in Bus Lanes on Bank Holidays!

There are many motorists with the same stories. 

http://www.govyou.co.uk/remove-the-ambiguity-re-bank-holiday-use-of-bus-lanes/

http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/news/local-news/warning-reveal-number-drivers-fined-8789712

attributes.action: Issue every Police Constable in England & Wales with a TASER by 01/01/17.
attributes.background: Police resources are continually stretch and the number of front line uniformed Police Constables is reduced year on year, whilst the number of violent crimes and assaults on Police continues to rise.  TASER is a proven less than lethal option and should be issued to front line uniformed officers.

attributes.action: Make mental health services more accessible
attributes.background: To make mental health services more accessible the Government should ensure that  no-one who approaches a mental health service should be turned away without help.
attributes.additional_details:
Anyone who goes to their GP or any other health care professional who is experiencing a mental health problem should be automatically referred to the crisis team who should act immediately. The onus should not be on the individual to contact the Crisis Team on their own. There should also always be a one to one therapy option, rather than group therapy.

Many people will know I haven't had an easy time with life or with mental illness; I suffer with depression anxiety PTSD and OCD. Recently, I've hit rock bottom and have screamed for help but have been let down by mental health services who I thought would help, instead they have let me down majorly.

attributes.action: More funding and awareness of mental health issues in young adults
attributes.background: After many friends suffering from mental health issues, I felt that this was an important topic, as mental health is often seen as inferior to physical illnesses

attributes.action: Political neutrality rules should apply to both TV & newspapers during elections
attributes.background: Whilst recognising the need for a pluralistic press the referendum campaign demonstrated media barons attempt to influence voting. We believe this to be wrong and that newspapers should adopt a neutral, balanced and fair position during campaigns as TV news is required to do

attributes.action: Don't cancel the British EU Referendum
attributes.background: In response to the petition "Cancel the planned referendum on Britain's continued membership of the EU" which is fundamentally an affront to the ability of the people to exercise their democratic will. Leave or Remain please show your support for a democratic process that enfranchises the people

attributes.action: Create new Animal and Domestic Pet Protection legislation to imprison abusers
attributes.background: Britian is a nation of animal lovers, with an estimated 46% of households having a domestic pet. Unfortunately however, animal cruelty offences continue to occur, with very little in the way of "animal rights" to prevent them, or to punish offenders. Pets mean more than the "property" defined in law
attributes.additional_details:
Recently introduced legislation in the US will allow courts to treat those who abuse animals in the same vein as humans. Numerous physiological research conclude that one of the first steps towards a person being mentally capable of taking another human life often start off abusing and killing animals

At the moment pet homocide can only be treated as 'criminal damage', but with people like the Croydon cat killer freely walking the streets we believe stronger legislation should be introduced.

attributes.action: We are calling on the Govt to strip Thameslink Govia of their rail franchise.
attributes.background: Govia Thameslink has the highest number of passenger journeys but the lowest customer satisfaction rates and the lowest PPM of any UK rail network. There has been a continuous decline in their PPM measure since 2015. They have the second highest rate of cancellation & significantly late running.
attributes.additional_details:
Thameslink Govia's poor management is evident in:
The lack of adequate contingency plans to cope with disruption.
Poor & inaccurate information provided to customers 
The ongoing staffing disputes without major disruption to the network. 
Continually increasing fares with declining service levels

We urge the government to urgently review the situation and award the franchise to a company which can deliver a consistent, good level of service.

attributes.action: Fund more beds in Northampton General to help reduce cancelled operations
attributes.background:
Northampton Hospital's Chief Executive Sonia Swart said 60 to 120 new beds are required to cope with daily pressures. She said: "Additional bed capacity would ensure patients operations weren't cancelled at the last minute." 
These beds are needed to ensure people get the right care.
attributes.additional_details: More beds at Northampton Hospital would 'save money' - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-northamptonshire-35937990

attributes.action: We demand an immediate increase in Government aid for the famine in Yemen
attributes.background: Children are starving to death in Yemen. Millions of people are malnourished & this is quickly becoming one of the most catastrophic famines of the 21st Century. A million & a half children are currently starving to death in a famine partly caused by damage inflicted by UK-provided weaponry.
attributes.additional_details:
Human Right's Watch Report detailing use of UK-made weaponry: https://www.hrw.org/news/2016/07/11/saudi-coalition-airstrikes-target-civilian-factories-yemen

7 Million people near starvation - Huffington Post: http://www.huffingtonpost.com/william-lambers/yemen-the-forgotten-famin_b_10864754.html

The role of the West in Yemen's war - The Economist: http://www.economist.com/news/middle-east-africa/21702651-lucrative-devastating-war-role-west-saudi-arabiau2019s-war

attributes.action: Make .22 Rimfire Pistols legal for Sporting purposes on FAC Certificates
attributes.background: In 1997 The UK Labour party Prime minister Tony Blair brought in The Firearm Ammendment Act of 1997 Number 2 which banned all .22 rimfire pistols for section 1 holders. I feel like the ban was unessecary and pointless and I feel that we have been treated as gulity people but we are not.
attributes.additional_details: Whoever holds a section 1 licence should have any gun they wish. Because what doesn't make sense is that if 22 rimfire semi auto rifles are legal then why can't we own a 22 rimfire pistol. If we somehow stand up against anti gun people and prove to them of how guns are not evil people that are bad are evil. If you even don't have a licence but support this sport you can push us to victory and freedom for this sport and live in a country with zero threat.

attributes.action: The UK must ban the foreign financing of all new MOSQUES
attributes.background: As we go forward in the Uk,it has become apparent that the Uk like other European countries has a problem with the financing of mosques.We call on the government to ban all foreign finance from building or the planning of any new mosques

attributes.action: Make Boris Johnson apologise to the People of Egypt for his untrue comments.
attributes.background:
We, the British people that are living in or visiting Egypt on a regular basis request that Boris Johnson apologise for saying that there is a burgeoning crisis in Egypt, when it is not true. 
We are living and visiting the country happily and safely, please come and visit us and see for yourself.
attributes.additional_details: There are numerous British expats here in Egypt that can confirm that his comments are not true.

attributes.action: Make it law for the tethering of horses to be a criminal offence.
attributes.background: A tethered horse is a horse on a length of chain. Unable to move beyond the confines of the chain and often without shelter, sufficient grazing and water. Many are tethered 24/7 and spend their days going round and round in circles. They are not living, just existing. You can help end this.
attributes.additional_details: If you would like to see instances of tethered horses and how  despondent and resigned to their fate they look then visit the Facebook page of  Save the Papermill Horses.

attributes.action: Stop the child tax credit cuts for a third child born from 6th April 2017.
attributes.background: This policy would lead to child poverty and charities are concerned that this would result in poverty and generations of lower classes whereby this right is only for the privileged. Those who said we are all in it together can not implement this policy. Thereby we urge the government to review this.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.childrenssociety.org.uk/sites/default/files/The%20Childrens%20Society%20-%20two%20child%20limit%20supplementary%20evidence.docx

http://www.barnardos.org.uk/poverty_full_report_07.pdf

attributes.action: Penalties against custodians turning away people accompanied by Assistance Dogs
attributes.background: Access discrimination to become a criminal offence with hefty statuatory fines put in place with further offenses increasing the fines given and lead to liquor, transport, or trading license being revoked
attributes.additional_details:
Across the UK, there are currently over 6,700 disabled and impaired people who have become the recipient of Assistance Dogs, specially trained to help them so that their disability is less of the daily burden it was before.
In 2010 the Government abolished the Disability Discrimination Act 1995, replacing it with the Equality Act 2010. This Act is insufficient in making companies fall in line with such procedures. This must be addressed with penalties put in place for non-compliance.
